attributes.action: Bring back compulsory dog licences. Making it offence to own a dog without one.
attributes.background:
Unfortunately back in 1987 when policing  issues were harder this law was Abolished. 
With modern laws and regulations a new licence can be enforced. 
This will aid in the reduction of Back Yard Breeding and the ever increasing over population of stray dogs in rescue centres accross the country.
attributes.additional_details:
Most countries still have licences. 
Having one makes the owner accountable for its dogs actions. 
If your dog goes missing the chances of getting it back are greater. 
No puppy can be bought without a licence including their vaccination details. 
Greater fines for owners without a licence.
DNA records would be held for prosecution and identification purposes. 
Breeders can only sell dogs with a recognised licence and permit.
Service dogs would be free. 
Elderly concession rates.

attributes.action: Review extra funding for m60 ring road and m56 and other adjoining motorways
attributes.background: Traffic chaos all around m60 ring road ever y day adding as much as 2 hours on to the journey , major problems Include m56 junctions 3 to 1 heading East to m60 anticlockwise at junction 3 cheadle
attributes.additional_details: M56 narrows to 2 lanes to join m60 4lanes to 2 causes bottleneck and traffic increasing up to 500,000 annually , nationally

attributes.action: Put cameras on Humber Bridge to catch speeders, tailgaters & poor drivers
attributes.background: The bridge is often closed for hours on end because theres been an accident caused by someones poor driving. The speed limit is 50, but drivers often go upwards of 60. The drivers are inches away from other car bumpers, trying to intimidate the other cars into going faster than the 50 limit
attributes.additional_details: There are cameras at the booths. These have witnessed road rage incidents, & drivers going through the tag lane above 50 (the limit at the booths is 30)

attributes.action: Change the NHS 24 week revival rule
attributes.background: At the moment doctors are under no legal obligation to help any babies born before 24 weeks gestation, from what doctors have told me this is because they say babies don't have developed lungs until 24 weeks. However the earliest baby to survive was born at just 21 weeks.
attributes.additional_details: 3 years ago my son was born at just 20 weeks, he was born alive and fought for his life for 2 hours before taking his last breath. Doctors did nothing to help my baby because of the 24 week rule, and I'm sure there are hundreds of families in my situation. Like I said the earliest baby to survive was born at 21 weeks, the only reason the hospital helped her is because she lied about how far gone she was. The bottom line of a hospitals job is to keep people alive when they enter the hospital.

attributes.action: Call for Turkey's removal from NATO
attributes.background:
The North Atlantic Council, should formally oust Turkey from NATO for good before its belligerence and continual aggression drags the international community into World War III.
Under Erdogan, our NATO ally has arrested more journalists than China, jailed thousands for the crime of free speech.
attributes.additional_details: Erdogan publicly flaunted his support for Hamas & ISIS while accusing Israel of crimes against humanity, violated an arms ban to Gaza, bought an air defense system from the Chinese in defiance of NATO, and denied America the use of its own air base to conduct strikes during the Iraqi War & ISIS in Syria. Turkey has been tacitly fueling the ISIS war machine. There is evidence to show that Turkey has allowed jihadists from around the world to swarm into Syria by crossing through Turkey’s territory

attributes.action: Fertility treatment, artificial insemination and IVF free for lesbian couples
attributes.background: It is wrong to make gay couples pay to start a family. It costs around £1500 per try and not every gay couple can afford this. Lesbians and gay couples should be provided with free fertility treatment. They want to start a family but cannot afford this. They should not be punished for being gay.

attributes.action: To prevent women from serving in frontline infantry units
attributes.background: In order to prevent a drop in morale among male ranks currently serving in frontline units.

attributes.action: Guarantee that EU nationals legally settled here before the Referendum can stay.
attributes.background: We should honour our responsibility to treat fairly our friends and colleagues from other EU countries, who were legally settled in the UK before the June 23rd Referendum.

attributes.action: Prior to any referendum a government inquiry be held on consequences either way.
attributes.background: Subsequent to the EU referendum committee hearings have been held revealing consequences, effects and subsequent necessary actions and criticism has been made of the claims made by campaigners, such information is useful to lawmakers and to voters. Rules for such campaigns/ campaigners are required.

attributes.action: Bring back retrospective death penalty for murderers and paedophiles
attributes.background: I am a British citizen. And am fed up with the way we have to pay for scumbags to "enjoy their captivity"

attributes.action: Article 50 Lisbon treaty can only be invoked by 2/3 's majority of MP's
attributes.background:
The recent referendum showed different needs across the UK. 
As a parliamentary democracy we trust in elected MP's to make decisions on our behalf. 
Only a plan that a significant majority of MP's can support will re-unite the UK
attributes.additional_details:
There is currently no plan. It is the job of parliament  to ensure 
that before article 50 is invoked there is robust, coherent and competent plan in place that is in the interests of the UK as a whole and will deliver clear advantages and benefits to the UK over the current status quo as a member of the European Union.

attributes.action: Call on the Saudi Arabian leaders to decriminalise homosexuality
attributes.background: In Saudi Arabia, same-sex sexual activity is punishable by floggings, life imprisonment, chemical castration, whipping torture and even the death penalty. People convicted twice are executed. Please call on the Saudi Arabian government to end the suffering of homosexuals in Saudi Arabia.

attributes.action: No sex Education in Primary School
attributes.background: Kids  never forgets these videos they watched from school and they come to INTERNET and watch them again and again
attributes.additional_details: Because it's completely inappropriate to the kids in Primary schools..

attributes.action: Article 50 to not be invoked until mandated by a special general election
attributes.background: Article 50 can only be invoked after passing through Parliament. This proposal allows the electorate to accept or reject the outcome of 'informal' negotiations with the EU through Parliamentary Democracy. All candidates voting intentions to be shown on the ballot paper - EXIT, REMAIN or UNDECLARED
attributes.additional_details: Following the close referendum result the consequences of the outcome have been more clearly understood by the electorate, deep divisions are evident in many areas. This proposal is designed to rebuild unity by making Parliament only accept the proposed 'informal' negotiated terms if so mandated by the electorate. As the voting intentions of each candidate are shown on the ballot paper, the result will either finally confirm the 'exit' referendum result or supersede it.

attributes.action: Reinstate A&E, renovate, modernise and expand High Wycombe General Hospital.
attributes.background: High Wycombe is a busy market town and hub for London commuters. As a newer college town its growing population has increased medical needs. Its Accident and Emergency Services were relocated to Stoke Mandeville, Bucks, which is 15.7m away (27 mins via the A413), or 13.2m (26 mins via Hampden Rd).
attributes.additional_details: Lives are jeopardised by transit times along country roads which are unsuitable for the task and make overtaking ambulances a traffic hazard. There is inadequate infrastructure to service the population, and that of neighbouring towns for whom Wycombe provided a closer A&E option. This petition calls upon the NHS, Wycombe District Council and Wycombe MP Steve Baker to renovate, modernise and expand the General Hospital in Wycombe, and reinstate Wycombe A&E as a flagship for the NHS in Bucks.

attributes.action: Hold 2nd EU referendum, allowing 16 & 17 year olds in Scotland to vote.
attributes.background: The Scottish referendum and EU referendum are linked. 16 & 17 yr olds were allowed to vote in the Scottish referendum. Scotland's position as part of the UK is now uncertain based on the Brexit result. Today's 16 & 17 year olds should be given the same rights to defend their future as in 2014.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36616028

2nd Scottish independence referendum likely: http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/24/alex-salmond-second-scottish-independence-referendum-is-certain

http://indy100.independent.co.uk/article/how-old-people-have-screwed-over-the-younger-generationin-three-charts--W1AA_n4nEb

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/06/26/scottish-independence-has-nearly-60-per-cent-support-poll-finds/

attributes.action: Call for an early election with support for proportional representation.
attributes.background: At a time where the country is in need of leadership, our representation has failed a public of diverse views. Reform is urgently needed to support a liberal democracy, with proportional representation; where ministers are elected based on their qualifications to represent a sector; all views count.
attributes.additional_details:
The lead up to the EU Referendum in the UK has exposed our leaders as being at odds with the public they are meant to serve. A vote of no confidence is required, not just in the party leaders and our Prime Minister, but also in the way the public are represented, and the way in which decisions are made on public services.

We, the undersigned, call for an early election - within the year; with reform for proportional representation and the right to elect ministers based on their qualifications.

attributes.action: England (w/o London) and Wales become independent and get only them out of EU
attributes.background: In the wake of the Brexit referendum results there are different calls for the breakup of UK. An alternative solution to satisfy the voters, keep UK whole and partially within EU would be to devolve England (w/o London) and Wales and let them leave EU (like Crown dependencies currently are).

attributes.action: Free University Education for English students now that we are leaving the EU.
attributes.background:
For too long we English students have been forced into paying ridiculous tuition fees for university. The Scottish, Welsh and EU students have their education free while we study almost drowning in debt. 

We have now voted to LEAVE the EU and hence can control how we pay for our education.
attributes.additional_details: The EU students can now be classed as international students making them pay for their education and with the surge of money, which supposedly isn't being spent on the EU membership fees, we english students should receive a free higher education.

attributes.action: Stop government invoking Article 50 until there is a deal in UK's interests.
attributes.background: Most MPs, who are well aware of their constituents interests, support remaining in the EU.  They are the appropriate people to judge if deal is in the U.K.'s interests.  MPs should have the power to to ensure their constituents interests are safeguarded before there is an exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Guarantee a minimum extra £100m per week invested into the NHS.
attributes.background:
'Vote Leave' have successfully won the EU Referendum and we can expect the UK to start proceedings to withdraw from Europe. 

'Vote Leave' campaigned with assurances that the money we are currently handing over to the EU could be better spent on our own public services.
attributes.additional_details:
Now that 'Leave' have won this referendum they need to live up to the promises made during the campaign and guarantee that this money will be spent on public services that greatly need extra support. 

"Let's give our NHS the £350 million the EU takes every week" was a specific slogan of the 'Leave' campaign. The 'Leave' campaign website also stated "Vote Leave to invest an extra £100m into the NHS every week".

These were explicit statements made during the campaign and many people have voted on the back of such promises made. The government needs to ensure that any negotiations out of the EU also includes assurances that funds currently paid to the EU be reinvested into our public services and specifically into our underfunded NHS.

attributes.action: Force County Councils to allow residents to use their closest recycling center
attributes.background: Many County Councils require proof of residency before allowing them to use their recycling centers. This forces people to travel extra distances to avoid crossing county borders to recycle. It is bad for the environment and councils should be forced to co-operate to limit this environmental damage.
attributes.additional_details: Residents of Sandhurst could travel a 6.6 mile round journey and use the Camberley recycling center. Surrey County Council are now not allowing cross county border use and as a result these residents are having to travel a 13.6 mile round journey to the Bracknell recycling center. This causes extra environmental damage and increased road use. This type of policy is in force in many areas of the country and should not be acceptable as a simple agreement between councils could stop this lunacy.

attributes.action: Postpone the EU referendum until David Cameron has negotiated an exit agreement.
attributes.background: It seems to be an unfair situation for the public to make such an important decision without truly knowing what an exit would cost. A strong leader should have negotiated terms for both staying in the EU and leaving. We will then be able to calculate the true cost of leaving or staying in the union.
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron spent only a short time negotiating with Europe about staying in the union. Another period of the same length should be spent negotiating terms for leaving the union. This might work in favour of the UK. Businesses would research all avenues for the best solution for them, this would help them make informed financial decisions. Recently the Conservative's published that £1 paid to the EU Equals £10 recieved. Maybe £0 paid will return £9, Nobody knows. Let's negotiate and find out.

attributes.action: Repeal the Act of Settlement (1700) and the Accession Declaration Act 1910.
attributes.background: The two acts that this petition demands to be revoked enforce religious discrimination in the succession to the monarchy; they require the monarch to be in communion with the Church of England.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition demands that the two acts mentioned in the title and the following links are repealed.

The Act of Settlement (1700) - http://www.legislation.gov.uk/aep/Will3/12-13/2/contents

The Accession Declaration Act 1910 - http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/Edw7and1Geo5/10/29/contents

attributes.action: Require ingredients to be listed on the packaging of all alcoholic drinks.
attributes.background: Soft drinks, rightly, have to list ingredients. We should also know what goes into the beer, wine and spirits that we consume.  Consumers will be able to make better decisions about what they drink if they know that preservatives,  flavourings or potential allergens are present.

attributes.action: Establish a publicly owned and possibly funded film production company.
attributes.background: For 70 years The British film industry has been dominated by the American industry there are two known reason for this fact. The first being that the Americans have the advantage on distribution side  and the second being that they know they’ll receive British funding through tax relief breaks.
attributes.additional_details:
the solution is to establish a national production company which would by run by elective committee of British film makers with the purpose of producing Public service feature length films.

references

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-34013145

http://www.theguardian.com/film/2015/feb/03/record-revenues-for-films-made-in-uk 

http://www.theguardian.com/film/video/2010/aug/28/uk-film-council-arts-funding?INTCMP=SRCH

http://screenrant.com/british-film-industry-hollywood/

attributes.action: Change Road tax back to engine size not emissions
attributes.background: The government changed Road tax to emissions based so those wealthy enough to afford new virtual emission free cars pay no Road tax but still 4 wheels wearing Road causeing potholes electric cars no Road tax paid

attributes.action: Strip police officers who have falsified statements, of their Police Pension.
attributes.background: We petition the Government to strip police officers found to have falsified statements following and relating to the Hillsborough Disaster of 15 April 1989 of their Police Pension. It is disgraceful that in the years since lies have been perpetuated. Change the law, enabling stripping of pensions.

attributes.action: Ban smoking outside pubs,restaurants and cafes to make a smoke-free Britain
attributes.background: We need to ban this because when people like to sit outside a restaurant in the summer if they do not smoke they do not want anyone smoking outside when they are eating the food.
attributes.additional_details: when you are just coming  in the a pub you do not want people outside smoking when you come you mind not want to go in the pub at the end.

attributes.action: Scrap the 15 year limit for voting rights of British citizens living abroad
attributes.background: British citizens who have lived abroad for 15 years are not allowed to vote at British elections. British citizens who live abroad in the EU will be the most effected by the results of the British referendum in June 2016. All of them must be allowed to participate in the referendum!!!
attributes.additional_details: British citizens who live abroad are also not allowed to vote in the country where they live because they do not have the citizenship in that country. They pay taxes and cannot vote in any country - this unfairness has to stop!!! The 15 year rule makes no sense in the modern world of telecommunication and with globally accessible media.

attributes.action: Legislate for homeopathic medicines to be tested to provide proof of efficacy.
attributes.background: Under current legislation it is permissible for the manufacturers of homeopathic medicines to sell their products and have them prescribed on the NHS without any proof that they are an effective remedy for any ailment. This has the potential to defraud the purchaser.
attributes.additional_details: Government guidance on the registration of homeopathic medicines. https://www.gov.uk/guidance/register-a-homeopathic-medicine-or-remedy

attributes.action: Prevent women from fighting in close combat roles in the British Armed Forces.
attributes.background:
- If a woman wants to serve on the frontline, they need to meet the same physical criteria as men, otherwise lives will be put at risk.
- It would cause discontent among serving members of the armed forces, with many threatening to leave if this becomes policy.
attributes.additional_details:
- Women should not qualify for combat roles with lower physical capabilities, for example they might have to carry a heavy male, with full armour to save his life.

- It would cloud judgement of male counterparts, who would instinctively choose to save a woman if two people's lives were in danger, despite not always being the right decision to take.

- Women, in the main, cannot carry 110lb on their back (as soldiers in Afghanistan did).

- There are already many combat roles open to women.

attributes.action: Help make it illegal for kids to have Smartphones under 12 yrs old to stop abuse
attributes.background: I believe that children under the age of 12 (at least) should only be able to have phones that can make a simple telephone call or simple text (without pictures) to prevent the abuse that is a growing problem using social media.
attributes.additional_details: I read in the national papers and hear from parents of their children and the problem in keeping them off their mobile telephones, there is enormous social pressure for a smart phone for kids which is not a healthy device at early ages I believe and want support to change the law.

attributes.action: Allow buyer to retain 5% of new build house price until build quality is correct
attributes.background: I am a new home owner. A year after moving in, I am fighting the house builder to complete my home to a satisfactory standard. Many of my neighbours are in a similar position. An incentive must be provided for the house builder to complete the house to the required quality standards.
attributes.additional_details: The house builder currently is paid the full amount of the house on exchange no matter how poor the quality of house delivered. New home buyers need more protection - the 10 year warranty is not sufficient to protect against poor quality. If the home buyer can retain 5% of the purchase price, then if the home builder cannot deliver the home to the required cosmetic and structural quality (which can be independently verified), then the home buyer should be allowed to keep the retained capital.

attributes.action: Ban UKPC from being able to recieve driver information from the DVLA.
attributes.background: On Mon 11/1/16 the BBC will air a broadcast about UKPC within their Inside Out West Midlands at 19:30 GMT. This will be avaliable on the BBC iPlayer afterwards also. UKPC have been found on the 9/15 to be in vialation and given sanction points. Now they have been found out again. Action is needed.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC Inside Out West Midlands is on Monday 11 January on BBC One at 19:30 GMT and available afterwards on iPlayer.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-35253759

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-lincolnshire-34402322

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3229165/Is-PROOF-private-parking-firms-scamming-motorists-Drivers-say-timings-photos-doctored-legally-parked-cars-issued-fines.html

http://forums.moneysavingexpert.com/showthread.php?t=4766249

attributes.action: Impose sanctions against the Philippine government for extra-judicial killings
attributes.background: The Philippine government is openly cleansing it's society of criminals by executing them. It is unacceptable for Britain to trade with a country that supports this policy. We demand that suspected criminals receive a fair trial as detailed in Article 10 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights
attributes.additional_details:
Drug addiction is linked to poor life chances and trauma and many addicts require support and don't deserve to be killed. 
https://www.drugabuse.gov/related-topics/addiction-science

attributes.action: Make single carriageway A-roads safer
attributes.background: Single carriageway roads are 7 times more dangerous than motorways. With a record £6m investment in our road network, the Government should legislate for physical barriers on single carriageway A-roads to prevent head on collisions, and for a reduction in the speed limit.
attributes.additional_details: Research by the Road Safety Foundation concluded that single carriageway roads are 7 times more dangerous than motorways. Having been involved in a high speed head on collision on a single carriageway A-road, a physical barrier in the middle of the road would prevent unscrupulous drivers from overtaking, thus eradicating the possibility of a head on collision. Moreover, a reduction in the speed limit from 60mph would also further improve road safety.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people with Crohns, Ulcerative Colitis
attributes.background: I suffer with this and I have to pay £104 a year for medication and that's with a prepayment prescription card. I can't live without this medication and I can get extremely poorly to the point hospital is required. I think this should be made free.

attributes.action: Introduction of a 1% Health and Care tax as soon as possible.
attributes.background: Population needs are rising beyond the levels that can be met by current treasury allocations to social care and to the NHS. The five year political cycle and the impact of austerity places vital services at significant risk from fluctuating investment and reorganisations.
attributes.additional_details: A new tax could provide some certainty while politicians consider all options for the future which should include an independent commission.

attributes.action: Abolish assured shorthold tenancies
attributes.background: Assured shorthold tenancies provide no security whatsoever for those in private rented accommodation. With tenancies being restricted to as little as six months, hard working families find themselves not knowing where or even if they are going to have a roof over their head in the immediate future.

attributes.action: Bring the child victims of the Syrian conflict to the UK and Europe.
attributes.background: Every day for the past five years a child has lost its life due to the conflict. The world has stood by for way to long and watched children pay the price for adult wars! it is my belief we have a OBLIGATION to rescue and protect as many of these children as we can.
attributes.additional_details: It is only since the outrage over Aylan Kurdi and now Omran Daqneesh the world has woken up and realized what the Syrian people have been dealing with as daily life for five whole years. It is in my belief we should ALL be doing what we can to evacuate these children and home them in safe countries. They do not deserve to pay the price for adult wars and this MUST be stopped! There must be relief provided and as many children evacuated as possible. Thank you all for your support.

attributes.action: Organise parade in London for TeamGB and ParalympicsGB following 2016 Rio Games
attributes.background: TeamGB is doing a breathtaking job in Rio and ParalympicsGB will do just the same.  This is a wonderful, breathtaking achievement and something everyone in the UK can take pride in.  We should show our appreciation as a nation by holding a homecoming parade like we did in 2012.

attributes.action: Spend £6m of foreign aid so 40 or Paralympics teams can attend Rio2016
attributes.background: There are around 40 countries that are unable to attend the Paralympics in Rio because of a funding shortfall. As well as being a good thing to do, it would show GB in a good light.  https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2016/aug/14/paralympic-committee-to-hold-budget-crisis-talks-with-brazil

attributes.action: Cancel BoE‘s cash injection to the financial sector, replace it with People's QE
attributes.background: The Bank of England’s planned cash injection to financial services will inflate asset prices, discourage saving and increase inequality. Government should instruct the Bank to implement a programme of People's Quantitative Easing instead to stimulate private spending and reduce UK household debt.
attributes.additional_details: Economists internationally have criticised the Bank’s decision, as it fails to address the greater risk to our economy: businesses and households cutting spending in the wake of increasing economic uncertainty. The BoE’s £375 billion programme of QE has damaged the UK economy since 2009 by inflating asset prices. These policies discourage saving and make it difficult for ordinary people to live, further increasing inequality and resulting suffering and anger that is corrosive to our society.

attributes.action: Encourage the EEA to pemit UK visa holders to travel freely in the Schengen area
attributes.background: As a resident in the UK with a valid UK visa, it seems unnecessary that a Schengen visa is required for tourism/business purposes in the Schengen area. Some form of long term visit visa with stringent background checks might be a good solution.
attributes.additional_details: I am an Indian citizen working as an Engineer in the UK. I enjoy travelling in my spare time and I also have the need to attend business meetings in the Schengen area. I have personally experienced the trouble of applying for short term visit visas (both Tourism and Business).  I encourage the the honourable UK govt. to urge the EU to look into a solution to this, by offering a longer term visa, with restrictions on the maximum number of days spent continuously in the EU. This solution could be offered to someone who has travelled to the EU at least twice, to prove that the country of interest is the UK.

attributes.action: To make sure every care home has CCTV  to protect the elderly
attributes.background: After my grandmother was treated appallingly by home care staff in her own home and in care homes.
attributes.additional_details:
The police have cameras attached to them and I think carers should have the same kind of thing to stop the abuse of elderly people.
My gran died from blood poisoning caused by bed sores after carers did not provide adequate care

attributes.action: Property Council Tax Must be Fair on the Amount of Bedrooms, Not as Now ?
attributes.background: At this time people pay the same amount from a Two Bed to a Six, this is unfair as a Two Bed does Not Create the same Waste as a Three/Four/Five or Six plus, many properties do extensions adding extra Bedrooms without the Councils knowing, Loft Bedrooms added, Brick Sheds made into a Bedroom etc.
attributes.additional_details:
A single person living on their own should Not have to pay the same as a Family of Five Six or More, it is a Loophole and unfair, the Law needs updating as when Rooms are added the Council Must be informed and their Council Tax increased as Appropriate and makes the system fair for All, should be Equal Rights.

Have got a complete list for a road which everyone pays the same from a Two Bed to a Six Bed, very wrong, let's have it fair.

attributes.action: Abolish A2 motorcycle licence and become fully un-restricted after 2 years
attributes.background: Back in 2013 the UK Government changed the laws on motorcycle licence having to take additional tests after being restricted for 2 years and having to fork out more money for for another mod1 and mod2 when it should go back to how it used to be and full unrestricted after 2 years automatically
attributes.additional_details:
16 cbt - 50 cc
17 cbt - 125cx now allowing 250 cc on L plates 
19 restricted licence 
21 derestricted license 
24 and above complete a direct access 

Remove the need for additional tests once passed restricted licence stay restricted for 2 years then automatically upgrade to full derestricted licence

attributes.action: GET WAITING TIMES OF DRIVING TESTS DOWN TO WITHIN 3 WEEKS
attributes.background: WAITING TIMES FOR DRIVING TESTS AROUND THE COUNTRY ARE GETTING LONGER AT THE MOMENT IT CAN BE AS LONG AS 3 MONTHS, THIS IS CAUSING SEVERE PROBLEMS TO PUPILS AND DRIVING INSTRUCTORS . ALSO TESTS ARE BEING CANCELLED  IN THE WAITING ROOM AND THE PUPILS ARE NOT GETTING THE REQUIRED NOTICE .
attributes.additional_details: IN MY AREA OF WORK THE EARLIEST DRIVING TEST APPOINTMENT IS 1ST NOV  THE DATE TODAY  IS 20TH JULY I WOULD CHALLENGE ANYONE IN THE COUNTRY TO FORECAST 3 MONTHS IN ADVANCE WEATHER A PUPIL WILL BE READY FOR THERE DRIVING TEST .THIS WAITING TIME IS NOT CAUSING JUST EXTRA PRESSURE ON A PUPIL TO PASS 1ST TIME BUT ALSO CAUSING THE DRIVING INSTRUCTOR EXTRA PRESSURE AND MAKING US LOOK LIKE COMPLETE IDIOTS. THE DVSA GET PAID FOR A SERVICE THEY ARE NOT PROVIDING CAUSING UNDUE STRESS AND PROBLEMS

attributes.action: Make Counselling and Psychotherapy a professional qualification.
attributes.background:
Anyone is able to set up in private practice and call themselves a Counsellor or Psychotherapist.
I would like a minimum qualification that is recognised by a regulatory body, such as the BACP, to benchmark a qualification to prevent poorly trained or unqualified individuals from practising.
